info.title: Cloudlets Origins for Application Load Balancer

post.description: For Application Load Balancer, run this operation to create a load balancing configuration. This operation is only available for the `APPLICATION_LOAD_BALANCER` origin type.

type.description: The type of origin this conditional origin is set up as. In this response the conditonal origin `type` is `APPLICATION_LOAD_BALANCER`.

description.description: A description you provide for each load balancing configuration.

checksum.description: The checksum that distinguishes this conditional origin from any others that might share the same name.

get.description: Lists the Application Load Balancer conditonal origins. You can use `type` to narrow the number of results returned. Options for the origin type include `APPLICATION_LOAD_BALANCER` for Application Load Balancer origins, `CUSTOMER` for standard origins, and `NETSTORAGE` for NetStorage-based origins.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Returns data for a specific type of origin as defined in Property Manager. Options include `alb` for Application Load Balancer origins, `customer` for standard origins, and `netstorage` for NetStorage-based origins.

200.description: Schema for a list of origins.

items.description: Schema for a Cloudlets Origin.

type.description: The type of origin this conditional origin is set up as. In this response the conditonal origin `type` is `APPLICATION_LOAD_BALANCER`.

description.description: The description of the load balancing configuration provided by a user.

checksum.description: The checksum that distinguishes this conditional origin from any others that might share the same name.

type.description: The type of origin this conditional origin is set up as, in this case `CUSTOMER`.

checksum.description: The checksum that distinguishes this conditional origin from any others that might share the same name.

hostname.description: The name of the host that can be used as a conditional origin.

type.description: The type of origin this conditional origin is set up as, in this case `NETSTORAGE`.

checksum.description: The checksum that distinguishes this conditional origin from any others that might share the same name.

hostname.description: The name of the host that can be used as a conditional origin.

get.description: Run this operation to get data for a specific conditional origin using the `originId`. Run the [List conditional origins](https://techdocs.akamai.com/cloudlets/v2/reference/get-origins) to get the `originId`. This operation is only available for the `APPLICATION_LOAD_BALANCER` origin type.

type.description: The type of origin this conditional origin is set up as. In this response the conditonal origin `type` is `APPLICATION_LOAD_BALANCER`.

description.description: The description of the load balancing configuration provided by a user.

checksum.description: The checksum that distinguishes this conditional origin from any others that might share the same name.

put.description: For Application Load Balancer, run this operation to update the description of an existing load balancing configuration. This operation is only available for the `APPLICATION_LOAD_BALANCER` origin type.

description.description: The new description of the load balancing configuration provided by a user.

type.description: The type of origin this conditional origin is set up as. In this response the conditonal origin `type` is `APPLICATION_LOAD_BALANCER`.

description.description: The description of the load balancing configuration provided by a user.

checksum.description: The checksum that distinguishes this conditional origin from any others that might share the same name.

post.description: You can create multiple versions of the load balancing configuration. By versioning these settings, you can test new configurations, or manage changes to the data centers supporting Application Load Balancer.

description.description: The description of the load balancing configuration provided by a user.

balancingType.description: The type of load balancing, either `WEIGHTED` or `PERFORMANCE`.

dataCenters.description: The object containing information on conditional origins being used as data centers for an Application Load Balancer implementation, as detailed [below](#datacenters). Only conditional origins with an `originType` of `CUSTOMER` or `NETSTORAGE` can be used as data centers in an Application Load Balancer configuration.

items.description: Contains information about the data centers where the origins are located.

city.description: The city in which the data center is located.

cloudServerHostHeaderOverride.description: When set to `true`, overides the host header for load balancing in a cloud environment.

cloudService.description: If `true`, caching for the data center is updated at a certain interval, like it would for a cloud-based service.

continent.description: The continent on which the data center is located. See [Continent Codes](https://control.akamai.com/dl/edgescape/continentCodes.csv) for a list of valid codes.

country.description: The country in which the data center is located. See [Country Codes](https://control.akamai.com/dl/edgescape/cc2continent.csv) for a list of valid codes.

hostname.description: The name of the host that can be used as a conditional origin.

latitude.description: The latitude value for the data center. This member supports six decimal places of precision.

livenessHosts.description: An array of strings that represent the origin servers used to poll the data centers in an Application Load Balancer configuration. These servers support basic HTTP polling.

longitude.description: The longitude value for the data center. This member supports six decimal places of precision.

percent.description: The percent of traffic that is sent to the data center. The total for all `dataCenters` objects within the array must equal 100%.

stateOrProvince.description: The state, province, or region where the data center is located. See [region codes](https://control.akamai.com/dl/edgescape/region_codes.txt).

deleted.description: If `true`, the conditional origin version has been deleted. If you set this member to `false`, you can use this version again.

livenessSettings.description: The object containing information on the liveness settings for an Application Load Balancer implementation, as detailed [below](#livenesssettings).

201.description: Returns details about an origin version.

schema.description: Details for a version of the Application Load Balancer configuration.

description.description: The description of the load balancing configuration provided by a user.

version.description: The version number of the activated load balancing configuration.

balancingType.description: The type of load balancing, either `WEIGHTED` or `PERFORMANCE`.

createdBy.description: The name of the user who created this load balancing configuration.

createdDate.description: The date and time, in ISO 8601 format, when this load balancing configuration was created.

dataCenters.description: The object containing information on conditional origins being used as data centers for an Application Load Balancer implementation, as detailed [below](#datacenters). Only conditional origins with an `originType` of `CUSTOMER` or `NETSTORAGE` can be used as data centers in an Application Load Balancer configuration.

items.description: Contains information about the data centers where the origins are located.

city.description: The city in which the data center is located.

cloudServerHostHeaderOverride.description: When set to `true`, overides the host header for load balancing in a cloud environment.

cloudService.description: If `true`, caching for the data center is updated at a certain interval, like it would for a cloud-based service.

continent.description: The continent on which the data center is located. See [Continent Codes](https://control.akamai.com/dl/edgescape/continentCodes.csv) for a list of valid codes.

country.description: The country in which the data center is located. See [Country Codes](https://control.akamai.com/dl/edgescape/cc2continent.csv) for a list of valid codes.

hostname.description: The name of the host that can be used as a conditional origin.

latitude.description: The latitude value for the data center. This member supports six decimal places of precision.

livenessHosts.description: An array of strings that represent the origin servers used to poll the data centers in an Application Load Balancer configuration. These servers support basic HTTP polling.

longitude.description: The longitude value for the data center. This member supports six decimal places of precision.

percent.description: The percent of traffic that is sent to the data center. The total for all `dataCenters` objects within the array must equal 100%.

stateOrProvince.description: The state, province, or region where the data center is located. See [region codes](https://control.akamai.com/dl/edgescape/region_codes.txt).

deleted.description: If `true`, the conditional origin version has been deleted. If you set this member to `false`, you can use this version again.

immutable.description: Indicates whether you can edit the load balancing version. The default setting is `false`. It becomes `true` when you activate the load balancing version for the first time.

lastModifiedBy.description: The user who last modified the load balancing configuration.

lastModifiedDate.description: The date and time, in ISO 8601 format, when the initial load balancing configuration was last modified.

livenessSettings.description: The object containing information on the liveness settings for an Application Load Balancer implementation, as detailed [below](#livenesssettings).

warnings.description: Provides error response data to help diagnose the problem that led to the error.

items.description: Provides error response data to help diagnose the problem that led to the error.

type.description: The error `type` uniquely identifies each distinct error case. An error can have multiple `types`.

title.description: The descriptive label for the overall problem.

detail.description: Provides actionable instructions to diagnose the problem that caused the error.

errors.description: Error objects that provide information for debugging.

items.description: Provides error response data to help diagnose the problem that led to the error.

type.description: The error `type` uniquely identifies each distinct error case. An error can have multiple `types`.

title.description: The descriptive label for the overall problem.

detail.description: Provides actionable instructions to diagnose the problem that caused the error.

errors.description: Error objects that provide information for debugging.

items.description: A further-nested HTTP problem object.

jsonPointer.description: The pointer to the error response JSON body.
The pointer to the error response JSON body.

get.description: For Application Load Balancer, run this operation to list all versions of a load balancing configuration. The response lists the versions in descending order.

200.description: Schema for a list of load balancer versions.

schema.description: Lists origin versions for load balancing.

items.description: Lists origin versions for load balancing.

description.description: The description of the load balancing configuration provided by a user.

version.description: The version number of the activated load balancing configuration.

createdBy.description: The name of the user who created this load balancing configuration.

createdDate.description: The date and time, in ISO 8601 format, when this load balancing configuration was created.

deleted.description: If `true`, the conditional origin version has been deleted. If you set this member to `false`, you can use this version again.

immutable.description: Indicates whether you can edit the load balancing version. The default setting is `false`. It automatically becomes `true` when the load balancing version is activated for the first time.

lastModifiedBy.description: The user who last modified the load balancing configuration.

lastModifiedDate.description: The date and time, in ISO 8601 format, when the initial load balancing configuration was last modified.

parameters.name: version
parameters.description: The version number of the policy.

get.description: For this operation, you have the option of using the `validate` query parameter.  When set to `true`, this parameter verifies whether the settings for the selected `loadBalancerId` and `version` are valid. The default setting for this parameter is `false`.

parameters.name: validate
parameters.description: For GET operations, verifies that the current settings for the selected `originId` and `version` are valid.

200.description: Returns details about an origin version.

put.description: Use this operation to update a selected load balancer version. You cannot edit a load balancer version that has ever been activated.

items.description: A further-nested HTTP problem object.

jsonPointer.description: The pointer to the error response JSON body.

warning.description: Provides error response data to help diagnose the problem that led to the error.

type.description: The error `type` uniquely identifies each distinct error case. An error can have multiple `types`.

title.description: The descriptive label for the overall problem.

detail.description: Provides actionable instructions to diagnose the problem that caused the error.

errors.description: Error objects that provide information for debugging.

items.description: Provides error response data to help diagnose the problem that led to the error.

type.description: The error `type` uniquely identifies each distinct error case. An error can have multiple `types`.

title.description: The descriptive label for the overall problem.

detail.description: Provides actionable instructions to diagnose the problem that caused the error.

errors.description: Error objects that provide information for debugging.

items.description: A further-nested HTTP problem object.

jsonPointer.description: The pointer to the error response JSON body.
The pointer to the error response JSON body.

post-origin-versions-response.description: Details for a version of the Application Load Balancer configuration.

description.description: The description of the load balancing configuration provided by a user.

version.description: The version number of the activated load balancing configuration.

balancingType.description: The type of load balancing, either `WEIGHTED` or `PERFORMANCE`.

createdBy.description: The name of the user who created this load balancing configuration.

createdDate.description: The date and time, in ISO 8601 format, when this load balancing configuration was created.

dataCenters.description: The object containing information on conditional origins being used as data centers for an Application Load Balancer implementation, as detailed [below](#datacenters). Only conditional origins with an `originType` of `CUSTOMER` or `NETSTORAGE` can be used as data centers in an Application Load Balancer configuration.

items.description: Contains information about the data centers where the origins are located.

city.description: The city in which the data center is located.

cloudServerHostHeaderOverride.description: When set to `true`, overides the host header for load balancing in a cloud environment.

cloudService.description: If `true`, caching for the data center is updated at a certain interval, like it would for a cloud-based service.

continent.description: The continent on which the data center is located. See [Continent Codes](https://control.akamai.com/dl/edgescape/continentCodes.csv) for a list of valid codes.

country.description: The country in which the data center is located. See [Country Codes](https://control.akamai.com/dl/edgescape/cc2continent.csv) for a list of valid codes.

hostname.description: The name of the host that can be used as a conditional origin.

latitude.description: The latitude value for the data center. This member supports six decimal places of precision.

livenessHosts.description: An array of strings that represent the origin servers used to poll the data centers in an Application Load Balancer configuration. These servers support basic HTTP polling.

longitude.description: The longitude value for the data center. This member supports six decimal places of precision.

percent.description: The percent of traffic that is sent to the data center. The total for all `dataCenters` objects within the array must equal 100%.

stateOrProvince.description: The state, province, or region where the data center is located. See [region codes](https://control.akamai.com/dl/edgescape/region_codes.txt).

deleted.description: If `true`, the conditional origin version has been deleted. If you set this member to `false`, you can use this version again.

immutable.description: Indicates whether you can edit the load balancing version. The default setting is `false`. It becomes `true` when you activate the load balancing version for the first time.

lastModifiedBy.description: The user who last modified the load balancing configuration.

lastModifiedDate.description: The date and time, in ISO 8601 format, when the initial load balancing configuration was last modified.

livenessSettings.description: The object containing information on the liveness settings for an Application Load Balancer implementation, as detailed [below](#livenesssettings).

warnings.description: Provides error response data to help diagnose the problem that led to the error.

items.description: Provides error response data to help diagnose the problem that led to the error.

type.description: The error `type` uniquely identifies each distinct error case. An error can have multiple `types`.

title.description: The descriptive label for the overall problem.

detail.description: Provides actionable instructions to diagnose the problem that caused the error.

errors.description: Error objects that provide information for debugging.

items.description: Provides error response data to help diagnose the problem that led to the error.

type.description: The error `type` uniquely identifies each distinct error case. An error can have multiple `types`.

title.description: The descriptive label for the overall problem.

detail.description: Provides actionable instructions to diagnose the problem that caused the error.

errors.description: Error objects that provide information for debugging.

items.description: A further-nested HTTP problem object.

jsonPointer.description: The pointer to the error response JSON body.
The pointer to the error response JSON body.
